altIdentifier.idno: Apparently not in Morley's handwritten catalogue.

msItem.title: Tarikh-i Mukhtasari dar Waqa'i'-i Fath-i Qistantiniyyah.
msItem.note: Translated from the Turkish by Muhammad Mahdi al-Shirvani al-Ansari. The date given in the colophon is stated to be that of the completion of the translation. Possibly this is the author's own copy, though it is likely that there were earlier drafts. Folio one, verso: Signature of David Price. A concise Account of the Conquest of Constantinople by Muhammad II and the early history of the City.
msItem.incipit: Bi-tarikh-i ghurrah- shahr-i Shawwal sanah-i 1209 Hijri

listBibl.bibl: Storey, i, p. 422. No other copy listed in Storey.
For the possible Turkish original see Franz Babinger, Die Geschichtsschreiber der Osmanen und ihre Werke, p. 30n.

condition.p: Some insect damage, probably from white ants.

bindingDesc.p: Red leather binding, presumably Indian, with coloured tooled and stamped decoration, and some painted gilding.

origin.p: Surat apparently. It is stated in the introduction (f1b) that the translator found the Turkish original there. 12 Muharram A.H. 1210. See notes.

acquisition.p: Bequest from Major David Price, received 5 March 1836.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
